hero.core_tension: Short, curated activations concentrate attention and revenue in 2 to 8 week windows. This matters because urgency raises full-price sell-through and reduces markdown pressure. Operators should prototype time-boxed activations and measure weekend foot traffic, dwell time, and sell-through.
hero.setting: Polished flagship storefront interior with strong negative space, a visible storefront window and an adjacent loading bay hinted in the background.
hero.persona: Store operator and creative lead standing in a planning posture, one holding a tactile sample, the other pointing to a scaled layout.
hero.action: Two people map a 6-week activation plan on a large paper grid, marking weekend spikes and capture points.
hero.urgency_symbol: Shifting patch of light across the grid suggesting a narrowing attention window; the mechanism is simple.
props: Folded schedule grid printed on heavy stock
Visitor flow dots on transparent acetate
hero.lighting: Polished editorial lighting with confident highlights and controlled shadows to isolate subjects and props
hero.alt: Operator and creative lead plan a 6-week activation; light slices across a schedule grid

signal_map.structure: Concentric rings with radial paths connecting a core store node to pop nodes; geometry suggests funnels and time-boxed bursts.
elements: Paths representing marketing to footfall conversion
signal_map.motion: Arcs converge to the core node in short bursts, then taper; the signal underneath is bursty, not steady.
signal_map.palette: Matte neutrals with a single confident accent color and metallic varnish on active arcs
signal_map.alt: Diagram of store as hub with bursty arcs showing short activation spikes
